newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia govt to keep aiming for low rates.
newsitem.headline: Australia govt to keep aiming for low rates.

text.p: The Australian government will keep up pressure to ensure that interest rates are as low as possible, Treasurer Peter Costello told a meeting of government members on Tuesday, according to a party spokesman.
"We will keep pressure on trying to keep interest rates as low as possible," spokesman Kevin Andrews quoted Costello as saying.
Andrews said Prime Minister John Howard told government members that recent interest rate cuts would flow through to the economy.
"He said that interest rates would flow through. He said there's a lag of 12 to 18 months between interest rate adjustments and consequences," Andrews told reporters.
The Reserve Bank of Australia has eased monetary policy four times in less than a year, reducing rates by 0.5 percentage points each time. Official cash rates are now at 5.5 percent.
The most recent cut was on May 23, while the first was in July last year. -- Canberra Bureau 61-6 273-2730
